ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: IT was a great final course in the GHS program because it gave us a really interdisciplinary approach to our competencies. Especially helpful if you hadn't taken a course in a competency or two. You learn a lot from the rich readings in the course, and by creating a presentation for the rest of the class
Increased awareness of previously unfamiliar aspects of global health,
I learned how to synthesize the central themes of the global health studies program and integrate the past 3 years of global health coursework in the program.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are that it covers the 6 competencies of the course, and the general workload was pretty low. Chill class and colloquium where you can speak up if you'd like.  Weaknesses were that we wished the professors would teach us, rather than it just being the students. Although I see the value in having students present on the topics in order to really engage themselves, we have two really awesome professors who have so much global health knowledge. Even if not every week, I would have loved to just hear them talk and lecture.

Strengths: exploration of many topics
Weaknesses: repetitive structure, not enough time for students to engage with one another

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: The course is limited to Global Health Scholars, but I will definitely say it is a worthy and engaging culmination to the MAP.

Yes. You have to take this course if you're in the GHS program. I'm glad that it's taught by PB and Dr. Fallon because they are excellent global health practitioners and academics. You will gain a lot just by engaging with them and the rest of your cohort for the last time at Yale
